FuncDef:
The stp max-hops command sets the maximum hops of a spanning tree in a Multiple Spanning Tree (MST) region.
The undo stp max-hops command restores the default maximum hops of a spanning tree. The stp max-hops command sets the maximum hops of a spanning tree in a Multiple Spanning Tree (MST) region. The undo stp max-hops command restores the default maximum hops of a spanning tree. By default, the maximum hops are 20 in an MST region.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum number of hops of a spanning tree in an MST region.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 40.

ExtraInfo: The devices on a Layer 2 network running Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol (MSTP) communicate with each other by exchanging Multiple Spanning Tree (MST) Bridge Protocol Data Units (BPDUs). An MST BPDU has a field that indicates the number of remaining hops.
